chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian L. Irwin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office upon release from jail if Agent has not already contacted the defendant.

miscConds.notes:
Costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.
Defendant is ordered to pay the $250.00 DNA surcharge, provide a sample for testing through the Dept. of Corrections as required in felony convictions.
Defendant is to remain employed at the level deemed appropriate by the agent.

Defendant shall attend counseling/programing as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request. Additionally defendant is to comply with all chapter 51 directives and requirements.
In regards to contact with December Irwin , defendant is not to have any violent, abusive or otherwise disorderly contact with her.

Defendant shall take all medication prescribed by a medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed. Additionally defendant is to keep all appointments with health care professionals.

timeConds.notes: Defendant to receive credit for 110 days served

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
